alert.note: Alert for Montgomery (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 18 at 7:18AM EST until December 18 at 7:07PM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Pennsylvania... Perkiomen Creek At Graterford affecting Montgomery County. For the Perkiomen Creek...including Graterford...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Perkiomen Creek at Graterford. * WHEN...Until this evening. * IMPACTS...At 8.0 feet, Park Avenue in Schwenksville is flooded. The Perkiomen Trail is flooded in Perkiomen Township at Plank Road and Route 113. At 11.0 feet, Graterford Road and Penitentiary Bridge are closed due to flooding. At 12.0 feet, Portions of Central Perkiomen Park in Collegeville are flooded. Flood waters expand onto and to the west of First Avenue in Collegeville. At 13.0 feet, First Avenue in Collegeville becomes impassable. At 14.0 feet, Storm sewers back up in Collegeville and flood Route 29. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:46 AM EST Monday the stage was 13.2 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 6:46 AM EST Monday was 13.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to crest soon at 13.7 feet. It is then expected to fall below flood stage this afternoon and continue falling to 2.7 feet early Thursday morning. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 13.2 feet on 09/27/1985. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Stream Fld Observed Fcsts (7 am) Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Tue Wed Stg Time Date Perkiomen Creek Graterford 11.0 13.2 Mon 6 am 3.9 3.6 13.7 7am 12/17 &&
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/phi. The next statement will be issued this evening at 715 PM EST.
